contentrichtext.text: {{Taxobox | name = Indonesian mountain weasel | status = DD | trend = unknown | status_system = iucn3.1 | status_ref = <ref name=iucn>{{IUCN2008|assessors=Duckworth, J.W., Barney, L. & Abramov, A. |year=2008|id=14019|title=Mustela lutreolina|downloaded=21 March 2009}} Database entry includes a brief justification of why this species is of data deficient</ref> | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Chordate|Chordata]] | classis = [[Mammal]]ia | ordo = [[carnivore|Carnivora]] | familia = [[Mustelidae]] | subfamilia = [[Mustelinae]] | genus = ''[[Mustela]]'' | species = '''''M. lutreolina''''' | binomial = ''Mustela lutreolina'' | binomial_authority = [[Herbert Christopher Robinson|Robinson]] & [[Oldfield Thomas|Thomas]], 1917 | range_map = Indonesian Mountain Weasel area.png | range_map_caption = Indonesian mountain weasel range }} The '''Indonesian mountain weasel''' (''Mustela lutreolina'') is a species of [[weasel]] that lives on the islands of [[Java]] and [[Sumatra]] in [[Indonesia]] at elevations over 1,000 metres (3,280 ft). They live in mountainous, tropical, and rainforest areas. Indonesian mountain weasels have a body length of 11–12 inches and a tail length of 5–6 inches. They are reddish-brown in color. The Indonesian mountain weasel is endangered due to [[hunting]], [[fur trade]], and [[habitat destruction|destruction of habitat]]. There are no subspecies of the Indonesian mountain weasel. ==References== {{reflist}} {{Carnivora|M.}} {{carnivora-stub}} [[Category:Weasels]] [[Category:Mammals of Indonesia|Weasel, Indonesian mountain]]
